TextView.n1:text: Yamaha 200 is named after the Japanese name of Peregrine Falcon, the fastest bird in the world which flies at a speed of 203 mph. At a top speed of 194 miles per hour, the Suzuki Hayabusa could even reach close to Peregrine falcon. Hayabusa is the fastest superbike from Suzuki. This ultimate superbike features a 1397 cc four-cylinder 16 valves, liquid cooled engine that produce the power of 197HP@6750 rpm. Key Specifications 1340cc, four-stroke, DOHC, 4-cylinder 16 valves engine. 6-speed constant mesh transmission. Maximum power:197 hp@9500 rpm. Maximum Torque: 155 Nm@7200 rpm. Top speed: 194 miles per hour. Bhp@ 10,000 rpm. Maximum torque:158.2 Nm@7500 rpm. Top speed: 208.1 miles per hour. 0 to 100 kmph: 2.7 seconds. 0 to 200 kmph: 7.2 seconds. Front brakes: 2*310 petal discs, four piston calipers. Rear brakes : single 250 mm petal disc, 2 piston caliper. 3 MTT Turbine Superbike Y2K, 227 miles per hour MTT Turbike Superbike Y2K
